intro: Pimpinella thellungiana, commonly known as the Alpine cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of theApiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are deeply lobed, and the flowers are small, white to pale yellow, appearing in clusters. Pimpinella thellungiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
